A reckless coder used two Blum integers as RSA primes. Crack the encrypted flag: 5708125981639581231772477498118592224426765367858846386875430220411185713499638589460979457183314586466747087489551037548043783594497651281498990269531356

The flag format is flag{...}

The lower 104 bits of p are: 45644321887680971651394820917486517847

## Challenge Technical Details
flag: flag{4gq3qid3}
cipher: RSA
ciphertext: 5708125981639581231772477498118592224426765367858846386875430220411185713499638589460979457183314586466747087489551037548043783594497651281498990269531356
vulnerability: blum integers
hint: Blum integers are products of primes congruent to 3 modulo 4. These integers have unique properties in cryptography.
necessary_info: The flag format is flag{...}
n=7683551862683040730835712996641262323174322710667840270866780669136686737478214279154163689226578218919836152806643872779574792062247487407137167241287737, e=2312490273511627434922418921342157921530673889277289545803961231105493722777633531305411777207092580783115599257043990931956267610956902909162369755872265
